name: Embrace
headline: Modern mobile observability built on OpenTelemetry
description:
*S19 and YCG F21*
Engineering teams shouldn’t be in the dark when it comes to the performance of their mobile apps and user experiences. With our industry-leading mobile observability technology, Embrace aims to give SRE and DevOps teams better insight into what matters most – their users – by tying mobile performance data to backend observability insights.

As the only user-focused, mobile-first observability solution built on OpenTelemetry, Embrace delivers crucial insights across both DevOps and mobile teams to illuminate real customer impact – not just server impact – to deliver the best app experiences. Customers like The New York Times, Marriott, Warby Parker, Masterclass, Home Depot, and Cameo love Embrace’s mobile observability platform because it makes extremely complicated and voluminous data actionable.

founders.name: Eric Futoran, Founder and CEO
founders.description:
Founder of Embrace, the only observability platform purpose-built for mobile. We proactively discover errors and instantly resolve issues for UX and Engineers, while delivering 100% of sessions and enriched data for Data Science.

Previously founder of Scopely, the #1 mobile games publisher with Yahtzee, Walking Dead, and Star Trek. Built the first DMP at Aggregate Knowledge.  First job was at Trilogy.

# Modern mobile observability built on OpenTelemetry
Discover the only user-focused, mobile-first observability solution built on OTel. By delivering crucial performance insights across DevOps and mobile teams, Embrace illuminates real customer impact – not just server impact – to deliver the best user experiences.
[Try Embrace](https://embrace.io/<https:/dash.embrace.io/signup/> "Try Embrace Pro")
[Request a demo](https://embrace.io/</request-demo/> "Request a demo")

### DevOps + mobile teams unite
Bring mobile into the fold. DevOps and SRE teams can now extend the craft of advanced, modern observability to mobile. Gain a higher fidelity picture of what is happening with your valued users by tying frontend mobile telemetry to backend performance data. OTel-compliant, open-source, mobile-first SDKs change the game by connecting user performance to business value.
[Go to product overview](https://embrace.io/</product>)
![](https://embrace.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/Screenshot-2024-06-03-at-10.23.02 AM.png) ![](https://embrace.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/Screenshot-2024-06-03-at-10.23.02 AM.png)
### The future of mobile observability is here
[ ![](https://embrace.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/mobile-obs-icon.png) Modern mobile observability  Gain a unified observability view and more sophisticated tooling for both backend and mobile teams  Learn more  ](https://embrace.io/</product/modern-mobile-observability/>) [ ![](https://embrace.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/2-2.png) OpenTelemetry for mobile  SDKs built on OTel for transparent, portable, and extensible data collection  Learn more  ](https://embrace.io/</product/opentelemetry-mobile/>) [ ![](https://embrace.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/38.png) App performance insights  Identify user-impacting app issues and resolve them quickly and painlessly  Learn more  ](https://embrace.io/</product/opentelemetry-mobile/>)
### OpenTelemetry for mobile
Embrace's open-source SDKs leverage our unique expertise of mobile user experiences to give engineers a mechanism for transparent, portable, and extensible data collection that adheres to the OpenTelemetry standard.
[Learn more ➔](https://embrace.io/</opentelemetry-mobile/> "Learn more")
![The Embrace and OpenTelemtry logos.](https://embrace.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/04/OTel_BlogImage.png)
  * 01

  * 03

  * 05


Previous 01/05 Next
![Embrace testimonials](https://embrace.io/wp-content/themes/embraceio/library/images/testi-quote.svg) ![Embrace testimonials](https://embrace.io/wp-content/themes/embraceio/library/images/black-quote.svg)
With the insights we get from Embrace, we never need to go back and add breadcrumbs just to investigate an issue. Instead, we can immediately access the data and context we need to identify the problem and deploy a fix on the very next release.
### Paul Weichhart
#### Lead iOS Engineer
![Paul Weichhart](https://embrace.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/4.png)
![Paul Weichhart](https://embrace.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/4.png)
![Embrace testimonials](https://embrace.io/wp-content/themes/embraceio/library/images/testi-quote.svg) ![Embrace testimonials](https://embrace.io/wp-content/themes/embraceio/library/images/black-quote.svg)
Embrace is the best monitoring solution we’ve found for our mobile games. The depth of insights they provide allows us to understand which issues to address and gives us the data our teams need to solve them. We can make better decisions for our business and users because of our partnership with Embrace.
### Bruno Dreux
#### Director of Engineering Operations
![Bruno Dreux](https://embrace.io/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/wildlife-logo-black.svg)
[Read customer story](https://embrace.io/</case-studies/wildlife/> "Read customer story")

Having the ability to see exactly what users experienced in the game, versus combing through and guessing, has been incredibly valuable for us.

![David Allanson](https://embrace.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/gramgameslogo.png)

Embrace has helped our team identify the source of issues, understand their impact, and ultimately solve them much more quickly and effortlessly than with previous tools.
### Dom Scandinaro
#### SVP of Engineering & Data

Black Friday is one of the most important events of the year. We use Embrace to monitor our platform and troubleshoot any problems while the live event is going on.

## What’s new from
## Embrace
OpenTelemetry
### [Why Embrace is leading the way in OpenTelemetry for mobile](https://embrace.io/<https:/embrace.io/blog/why-embrace-opentelemetry-mobile/>)
Embrace is modernizing full-stack observability by providing open source, portable, and extensible mobile frameworks to OTel for site reliability and developer teams.
[Read More](https://embrace.io/<https:/embrace.io/blog/why-embrace-opentelemetry-mobile/>)
eBook
### [Craft better SLOs with our new guide for DevOps, SRE, and mobile engineering teams](https://embrace.io/<https:/embrace.io/blog/mobile-slo-guide/>)
We're excited to release our new guide for DevOps, SRE, and mobile teams around building better SLOs. This guide will help teams design and implement SLOs that address the incredibly complex, unpredictable nature of mobile in a way that centers the end user experience. 
[Read More](https://embrace.io/<https:/embrace.io/blog/mobile-slo-guide/>)
grafana
### [Embrace and Grafana Labs: Bringing the mobile app into your modern observability solution](https://embrace.io/<https:/embrace.io/blog/embrace-grafana-labs-partnership-technical-integration/>)
Enable full-stack observability with unparalleled visibility into mobile user experiences.
[Read More](https://embrace.io/<https:/embrace.io/blog/embrace-grafana-labs-partnership-technical-integration/>)

# Modern mobile observability built on OpenTelemetry
Discover the only user-focused, mobile-first observability solution built on OTel. By delivering crucial performance insights across DevOps and mobile teams, Embrace illuminates real customer impact – not just server impact – to deliver the best user experiences.
Try Embrace⟨44⟩
Request a demo⟨45⟩

### DevOps + mobile teams unite
Bring mobile into the fold. DevOps and SRE teams can now extend the craft of advanced, modern observability to mobile. Gain a higher fidelity picture of what is happening with your valued users by tying frontend mobile telemetry to backend performance data. OTel-compliant, open-source, mobile-first SDKs change the game by connecting user performance to business value.
Go to product overview⟨46⟩
![](https://embrace.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/Screenshot-2024-06-03-at-10.23.02 AM.png) ![](https://embrace.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/Screenshot-2024-06-03-at-10.23.02 AM.png)
### The future of mobile observability is here
 ![⟨47⟩ Modern mobile observability  Gain a unified observability view and more sophisticated tooling for both backend and mobile teams  Learn more  ](https://embrace.io/</product/modern-mobile-observability/>)  ![⟨48⟩ OpenTelemetry for mobile  SDKs built on OTel for transparent, portable, and extensible data collection  Learn more  ](https://embrace.io/</product/opentelemetry-mobile/>)  ![⟨49⟩ App performance insights  Identify user-impacting app issues and resolve them quickly and painlessly  Learn more  ](https://embrace.io/</product/opentelemetry-mobile/>)
### OpenTelemetry for mobile
Embrace's open-source SDKs leverage our unique expertise of mobile user experiences to give engineers a mechanism for transparent, portable, and extensible data collection that adheres to the OpenTelemetry standard.
Learn more ➔⟨50⟩
![The Embrace and OpenTelemtry logos.⟨51⟩]

### Why Embrace is leading the way in OpenTelemetry for mobile⟨62⟩
Embrace is modernizing full-stack observability by providing open source, portable, and extensible mobile frameworks to OTel for site reliability and developer teams.

We're excited to release our new guide for DevOps, SRE, and mobile teams around building better SLOs. This guide will help teams design and implement SLOs that address the incredibly complex, unpredictable nature of mobile in a way that centers the end user experience.

generated_description:
**Company Overview: Embrace**

**Founding and Background:**  
Embrace was founded in 2016 as part of Y Combinator's Batch S19 and YCG F21. Based out of Los Angeles, CA, Embrace started with a mission to remove the ambiguity surrounding mobile app performance. With a core team of 52, the company has positioned itself as a leader in modern mobile observability by leveraging OpenTelemetry.

**Mission Statement:**  
Their mission is straightforward: to provide modern mobile observability built on OpenTelemetry. This pioneer approach ensures that engineering teams can see exactly how their mobile apps are performing from a user-centric perspective, not just server metrics. 

**Why Embrace Matters:**  
In today's mobile-dominated landscape, understanding the user experience is more vital than ever. Embrace effectively connects mobile performance data with backend observability insights, ensuring that both SRE and DevOps teams have the crucial insights they need to enhance user experiences. They're not just tallying errors; they focus on real user impacts – and that's a game changer.

**Key Features:**
- **Mobile Observability:** Embrace specializes in mobile-first observability, meaning that they provide insights that empower mobile developers to grasp their app's performance in a way that traditional tools often overlook.
- **OpenTelemetry Integration:** As the only user-focused solution built on OpenTelemetry, Embrace stands out by embracing open-source solutions while delivering powerful mobile observability tools.
- **Performance Insights:** Their tools offer in-depth performance metrics, troubleshooting capabilities, and user timeline insights, leading to quicker resolutions and better user experiences.

**Customer Base:**  
Embrace is trusted by a host of leading brands, including The New York Times, Marriott, Warby Parker, Masterclass, Home Depot, and Cameo. These companies rely on Embrace to make complex and voluminous data actionable, ultimately influencing their app performance strategies.

**Use Cases and Industries:**  
Embrace caters to several key industries:
- **E-commerce and Retail**
- **Travel and Hospitality**
- **Media and Entertainment**
- **Gaming**

The versatility of their solution allows them to tackle a variety of use cases including the unification of mobile and backend observability, client-side networking solutions, and enhancing team collaboration across the board.

**Resources for Developers:**  
Embrace provides extensive resources, including eBooks, webinars, and case studies, helping teams across sectors to learn better practices in SLO development and refine their observability strategies.

**Conclusion:**  
For teams looking to enhance their mobile app performance and user experiences, Embrace is not just another tool—it's a strategic partner. By putting users at the forefront of performance observability, Embrace allows teams to make informed decisions that directly benefit their customers. If your mission is to understand users and turn those insights into actionable strategies, Embrace is worth a serious look. 

**Explore Embrace:** [Visit Website](https://embrace.io)
